author: Esra Gurkan For Mailonline
title: Employees reveal SECRET perks they give to nice customers | Daily Mail Online
text: Share Sometimes shoppers can benefit in the most unexpected ways - especially if they're polite It's nice to be nice - and it might even get you extra chicken nuggets at McDonald's Would the threat of sour milk in your latte encourage you to be more polite to a barista? The confessions from staff are proof that you should treat others how you'd like to be treated Choosing to be polite rather than rude and impatient can be the difference between a surprise discount (left) or a smaller than usual burrito (right) Every penny counts - so be nice, and save on the cost of your dipping sauce Sometimes it's not down to whether a customer is polite or not, but rather how good looking they are We all know how pricey cinema snacks can be, so try being nicer to the staff and you might get more for your money You might find your burger unexpectedly 'super-sized' if you play your cards right where this person works The confessions outline the various ways that good manners can pay off - from discounts to extra timbits at Tim Hortons It's not just fast food restaurants - being nice can even pay off at your local Credit Union It seems as though 'forgetting' to scan the occasional item is a well-known trick among fast food workers Read more: Share or comment on this article 41
